Assaf Arkin wrote:

> 
> From an engineering standpoint I would recommend and use POST because
> it's more explicit and clear.
> 

Agreed.  Like I said in another thread, just write an HTML form and a
POST handler to do "batch" deletions.  So long as it's understood that
this has nothing to do with a uniform interface.  In REST, the
semantics assigned to DELETE are not also duplicated in POST --
deletion of resources has one and only one method.  POST is usually
being used to accept data, making it sometimes mean delete makes the
semantics of POST clear as mud.

-Eric
